snp4.2:5.2: Anīgha: The Pāli is actually plural, _bhavesu_, but in English ”being” in this sense is always singular. Hence the addition “states of”.
snp4.2:7.1: Anīgha: The reference here is to the two “ends” (_anta_) of _phassa_ discussed in AN 6.61.
snp4.2:7.2: Translating _phassa_ as “experience”: “Dependent on the eye and forms, eye-consciousness arises; the meeting of the three is [an] experience. With experience, there is feeling; with feeling, craving …” (SN 12.43)
